summary: This mod adds Arisverd, a unique 1 handed sword, to Skyrim. Along with Arisverd you will find a journal; this journal explains how the sword got to where it is when you find.
descriptionHtml:
[img=center]http://i.imgur.com/o5I932U.png[/img]
[color=#ffa71a][b]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
DESCRIPTION
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[/b][/color]
This mod adds Arisverd, a unique 1 handed sword, to Skyrim. Along with Arisverd you will find a journal; this journal explains how the sword got to where it is when you find. In terms of Tamrielic history, what is laid out in the journal happened fairly recently. What the story of the sword beyond that is is not known at the moment. If you are interested in crafting the sword check the last pages of M'wah's journal (need the daedric crafting perk); Arisverd is primarily made of steel. Arisverd can be improved at a sharpening wheel using a steel ingot. Arisverd can be enchanted.

[color=#ffa71a][b]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
LOCATION
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[/b][/color]
Travel to Ivarstead to begin your ascent up the 7000 steps to High Hrothgar. Begin your ascent. Along the way watch for the first flag stone and Emblem III. From there, follow this map:
[img=center]http://i.imgur.com/zolqAyo.png[/img]

[color=#ffa71a][b]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
INSTALL
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[/b][/color]
[color=#ff5400]OPTION 1:[/color]
Install with NMM
[color=#ff5400]OPTION 2:[/color]
[list][*]download the mod's main file from the nexus
[*]extract the archive (the file you just downloaded) using winrar or 7zip
[*] if using Windows 7 or Vista____move or copy all files from the mod's data folder (in the folder created after extraction) to Skyrim's data folder
[*]if using XP____move or copy all files from the mod's data folder (in the folder created after extraction) to Skyrim's data folder, navigating through folder trees as ____necessary to avoid replacing other files
[*]start up the Skyrim launcher
[*]select DATA FILES
[*]check the Arisverd.esp check box if unchecked
[*]play Skyrim and get the sword
[/list][color=#ffa71a][b]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
NOTES
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[/b][/color]Endorsements are appreciated.
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23380]Arisverd SkyRe patch[/url] by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/3861735]DobyDude[/url]

ArisverdSSBv11:
ArisverdSSB includes an optional .esp file which can be used in place of the main Arisverd.esp (activate ArisverdSSB.esp and de-activate Arisverd.esp in Skyrim launcher data files section). ArisverdSSB.esp re-balances the sword to do the same DPS as it's Skyforge steel equivalent (applies to the 2h version as well). The DPS in the main file is the same as equivalent daedric weapon (daedric sword).
The daedric crafting perk is not needed to craft Arisverd when using the ArisverdSSB.esp. The steel crafting perk is required.

Arisverd Speed Balance:
The file "Arisverd Speed Balance" contains two .esp files (Arisverd.esp and ArisverdSSB.esp). If you'd like the attack speed of the weapons to be inline with vanilla weapons, use these in place of the .esp file that comes with the main file or the .esp file that comes with ArisverdSSBv11.

[color=#ffa71a][b]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
CHANGELOG
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[/b][/color]
[color=#ff5400]VERSION 1.1[/color]
[list][*] added crafting for both the 1h and 2h versions
[*] added crafting recipe to M'wah's Journal
[*] recreated the nif file for the 2h sword (equipping the 2h sword was causing random crashes)
[/list][color=#ffa71a][b]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
PERMISSION
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[/b][/color]
